epoetics.core

Class Linguistic_Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • epoetics.core.Linguistic_Element
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Annotation, Chapter, Document, Line, Page, Paragraph, Sentence, Tag_Cloud, Token

    public class Linguistic_Element
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is the base class for all linguistic and organizational elements of a text. It defines the attributes and elements a linguistic and organizational element must posses. The properties any linguistic or organizational element of text in our model has are: 1. start offset and end offset: The character positions in the original text where the element is located. Attributes of elements, like the part-of-speech tag of a word, are given by String fields of a particular class, but the string the element consists of is only given by offsets. 2. A note_history: The note history stores the notes a user attaches to a particular element. The keys are dates and the values are the notes themselves. 3. A getString method: This method returns, given the string representing a text, the substring which represents the element in the text. You have to take care that you call this method with the string of the text the linguistic or organizationl element is derived from, otherwise you will get nonsensical results.
    Author:
    Andreas Müller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int end
      End offset of the linguistic element in the original text of the document the linguistic element is contained in.
      (package private) java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> note_history
      A map from dates when the notes where made to notes a user made for the linguistic element.
      (package private) int start
      Start offset of the linguistic element in the string of the document the linguistic element is contained in.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String original_text)
        Get the string constituting the linguistic element. This method needs the text of the document the linguistic element is contained in because the string of a linguistic element is not stored, so the string of a linguistic element is retrieved from the text of the document.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Get the string representation of this linguistic element.
